HPI 8419 Nissan GT Silvia 1993 JGTC Series 2nd Place T. Kinoshita



The All Japan Sports Prototype Championship (JSPC) came to an end in 1992 and was replaced by the Japanese Grand Touring Championship (JGTC) in 1993. Nissan’s in-house NISMO team entered 2 cars in the new series’ GT class. One was the Calsonic Skyline GT-R R32 driven by Masahiko Kageyama and the other was the GT Silvia S13 seen here driven by Takayuki Kinoshita (rounds 1 & 2) and Hideo Fukuyama (round 4). The Silvia was a modified version of the N2-spec Super Silvia built to compete in a one-make Silvia series.

Kinoshita finished in 7th in both of the rounds he contested and finished the series in 2nd place overall.
